input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CITY OF LIESTAL, CIVIL ENGINEERING SECTOR. Summary: External Administrative Department for Wastewater (Control Body for Wastewater Connection Requests). Description: The city of Liestal is tendering a service for an external wastewater department (supervisory body, property drainage specialist / client support). The specialist office processes wastewater connection requests and carries out inspections Acceptance of private property drainage systems. Per On average, 40 to 60 applications are examined each year. The time required for this is recorded in Chapter 7 (Offer). The actual amount of work depends on the economy and can vary. A linear/constant workload cannot therefore be guaranteed when placing an order for the service. The resulting service contract will be concluded from January 1, 2027 for a term of 5 years. The Notice period is 6 months before the end of the year. The notice of termination must be delivered by registered mail. The services include the technical preliminary review, application review, on-site execution controls, final inspections as well as the review of the audit documents TV logs. The services are provided in accordance with the applicable regulations, the GEP of the city of Liestal and the cantonal/federal regulations. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CITY OF DIETIKON (DRESO). Summary: City of Dietikon - Submission Cleaning Glanzenberg Train Station. Description: The station is owned by the city of Dietikon. The station consists of a waiting hall, a public toilet, a station pavilion, a bicycle parking hall, an outdoor and intermediate platform, two passenger underpasses (east and west) and the Outbuildings in the basement. The city of Dietikon is responsible for the maintenance and appropriate use of the station pavilion. Winter service including snow removal is contractually regulated and is provided by SBB AG for an unlimited period of time taken over. Description: The 2K5 project is the expansion of the Zurich-Hagenholz waste-to-energy power plant by a third one Combustion line. The project consists of the main and secondary procedural lots. For details see Part B project description. The dry slag discharge The existing two lines 2K1 and 2K3 will be converted as part of the project. During the assembly period, the slag from the two lines is discharged wet for around eight months (2K1) and three months (2K3). Subject of this tender the loading, transport, unloading and subsequent landfilling of the wet discharged slag (90 tons per line per day, total approx. 31,000 tons) at an approved Type D landfill in Switzerland. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: PAUL SCHERRER INSTITUT (PSI). Summary: Dismantling of Alpha Laboratories. Description: Within the scope of this tender, it is planned to dismantle the infrastructure of two alpha laboratories of the PSI hot laboratory (Hotlab), which was used for fuel research programs between 1979 and 2005 and is in a controlled area. The infrastructure mainly includes glove boxes and equipment for the treatment, preparation, and analysis of fuels. By dismantling these, the plant operator fulfils the obligations of the KEG and the KEV. The aim of the tender is to create a concept for the dismantling of this infrastructure, their installation and commissioning and to carry out the dismantling measures. <br> Doc Title: Dismantling of Alpha Laboratories <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-17. Closing Date: 2026-03-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Dismantling of Alpha Laboratories

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: TRIDEL SA. Summary: Submission of Rail Transport Services for Incinerable Waste and Residues. Description: This is a service contract which includes all transfers to the contracting party's station for its waste supply and from this same station for the evacuation of bottom ash and ashes. The market is divided into two lots: · description of the services of lot 1: transport, in closed skips belonging to the contracting authority, or sometimes in open skips, of waste coming from the entire supply area of ​​the contracting authority (maximum 8 transshipment points rail/road), or even inter-plant transfers (shipment of waste to other recovery plants during TRIDEL shutdown periods); · description of the services of lot 2: transport in open skips of bottom ash and washed ashes from the adjudicator to the de-metallization centers, respectively the landfills. Importance of the market: Total tonnage of waste to be transported per year: approximately 90,000 tonnes Total tonnage of clinker/ash to be evacuated per year: approximately 35,000 tons Number of road/rail transshipment points: max 10 Number of unloading stations: 1 for lot 1 and 3 to 4 for lot 2 rail transport services for incinerable waste This is a service market which includes all of the transfers to the contracting authority's station for its waste supply and from the same station for the evacuation of bottom ash and ashes. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: EPFL - PURCHASING DEPARTMENT. Summary: Maintenance Cleanings 2026-2031 @Epfl. Description: In order to optimize the quality of cleaning services on its various sites, EPFL wishes to tender the maintenance cleaning of a certain number of premises and buildings. This approach will be carried out in accordance with the laws on public procurement, the directives of SECO (State Secretariat for the Economy) as well as those of the DSE (Safety and Operations Domain of EPFL) and the collective agreements of the employment sectors concerned. Standard premises Lausanne site The market includes maintenance cleaning services for standard premises at the EPFL Lausanne Site as well as additional work linked to these services (cleaning of glass surfaces, in management, etc.) according to the requirements and prescriptions of the Conditions execution techniques (Appendix 1), and the NLP Catalog (Appendix 1.1). Laboratories with special requirements Lausanne site The contract includes maintenance cleaning services for laboratories with special requirements according to the requirements and requirements of the technical conditions of execution (Appendix 1). of the PNL Catalog (Appendix 1.1), and the SV Safety Concept (Appendix 1.2). Clean rooms Lausanne site The contract includes maintenance cleaning services for the site's clean rooms of Lausanne according to the requirements and prescriptions of the Technical Execution Conditions (Appendix 1). of the PNL Catalog (Appendix 1.1), as well as the description of the PNL 209 White Room (Appendix 1.3). input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE FOR CIVIL AVIATION FOCA. Summary: (25262) ​​803 Call for External Offices and Economic Audits for the Aviation and Climate Funding Program. Description: According to Article 3 of the Federal Act on Climate Protection Goals, Innovation and Strengthening Energy Security (KlG; SR 814.310), human-caused greenhouse gas emissions in Switzerland should be zero by 2050 (Net zero target). This goal also applies to Swiss air traffic. In the 2024 report on CO2-neutral flying by 2050, the Federal Council shows the necessary measures for this. In addition to improved aircraft technology and operational Improvements, the use of sustainable aviation fuels (SAF) as so-called drop-in fuels represents the most important technical measure for reducing fossil CO2 emissions in aviation. Main CPV: 90700000 Environmental protection services. Published Date: 2025-12-03. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SEEZTAL WASTEWATER ASSOCIATION. Summary: Tender for General Planning of Wastewater Connection to Walenstadt. Description: Since the two sewage treatment plants, ARA Seez and ARA Walenstadt, need to be renovated and expanded due to their age and capacity in the next few years, the Seeztal wastewater association, which was founded at the beginning of 2024, intends to cover the catchment areas of the ARA Seez with the communities of Flums, Mels, Quarten and part of Walenstadt and the ARA Walenstadt at the site of today's ARA Seez and to build a new, future-oriented sewage treatment plant. This tender for the Walenstadt connection defines the planning and implementation of the project with a pumping station and storm overflow basin in Walenstadt and pressure line to the new sewage treatment plant as well as the dismantling of the Walenstadt ARA, which are required as a general planning mandate. Electrical planning services are excluded from this due to the interface to the ARA Seeztal project.<br> Main CPV: 90400000 services in wastewater disposal. Published Date: 2025-11-21. Closing Date: 2026-01-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Tender for General Planning of Wastewater Connection to Walenstadt
output.Description: Since the two sewage treatment plants, ARA Seez and ARA Walenstadt, need to be renovated and expanded due to their age and capacity in the next few years, the Seeztal wastewater association, which was founded at the beginning of 2024, intends to cover the catchment areas of the ARA Seez with the communities of Flums, Mels, Quarten and part of Walenstadt and the ARA Walenstadt at the site of today's ARA Seez and to build a new, future-oriented sewage treatment plant. This tender for the Walenstadt connection defines the planning and implementation of the project with a pumping station and storm overflow basin in Walenstadt and pressure line to the new sewage treatment plant as well as the dismantling of the Walenstadt ARA, which are required as a general planning mandate. Electrical planning services are excluded from this due to the interface to the ARA Seeztal project.<br> Main CPV: 90400000 services in wastewater disposal

Description: HOCH Health Ostschweiz (hereinafter HOCH) plans to outsource window cleaning to external service providers in order to ensure the long-term preservation of the value of its buildings. This tender originally concerns five locations, including the St. Gallen Cantonal Hospital and the hospitals in Grabs, Linth, Altstatten and Wil.<br> The framework agreements have a fixed term of three years with the possibility of extension for one year at a time, but for a maximum of two years in total.<br> Note: Lot 11 (Altstatten Hospital) will not be continued. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: STATE SECRETARIAT FOR ECONOMIC AFFAIRS (SECO). Summary: Resilient and Efficient Utilities in North Macedonia. Description: The project's main goal is to boost the resilience and efficiency of urban water and wastewater Utilities in North Macedonia and thereby contribute to the cities- economic development. To achieve this, the project aims to improve the organizations, operational and financial performance of seven Public Utilities while increasing their energy efficiency and expanding the use of renewable energy. Key supporting factors for success include the gradual upgrade of Utility infrastructure, as well as the integration of energy efficiency aspects in the regulatory and institutional framework. An Implementation Consultant will assist the Utilities with corporate development support to improve their business planning, reduce non-revenue water, adopt energy efficiency approaches for water and wastewater services, and implement renewable energy measures. Through the increased energy efficiency and a sound business planning, the project contributes to the sustainability of infrastructure investments which is a pre-requisite for economic development and to climate mitigation. On national level, the IC will support the Regulator to strengthen its capacities in the supervision of the Utilities- investment planning, energy audits and tariff structures. Find further information in the documentation. <br> Doc Title: Resilient and Efficient Utilities in North Macedonia <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-09-30. Closing Date: 2025-11-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: State Secretariat for Economic Affairs (SECO)

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE FOR THE ENVIRONMENT BAFU, AIR POLLUTION CONTROL DEPARTMENT AND CHEMICALS. Summary: Documentation Site Air Pollution and Health (Ludok 2026+). Description: The Environmental Protection Act (USG) obliges the Federal Council to determine immission limit values (IGW) to assess harmful or annoying effects due to air pollution (Art. 13 USG). The law contains a binding catalog of criteria on how to set IGW. Based At the status of science or experience, IGW, among other things, must be determined in such a way that immissions below these values do not endanger people, animals and plants and do not significantly disturb the population in their well -being (Art. 13 and 14 USG). If there is no IGW for a pollutant, The immissions are considered excessive if they endanger people, animals and plants and significantly disrupt the population in their well -being (Art. 2 Para. 5 LRV). The authority must assess whether the determined immissions are excessive (Art. 30 LRV).<br> The BAFU - as the environmental authority of the federal government - has the task of pursuing the progressive state of scientific knowledge of the health effects of air pollutants, evaluating immissions, informing the population and, if necessary, an application for an adaptation of the immission limit values of the To provide air pollution regulation (LRV). The examination of the effects of air pollutants on the health of the population is a priority issue in the research concept 2025-2028 of the BAFU (focus II-immission protection, research area 8 air, priority research issues: Bew .... Published Date: 2025-08-07. Closing Date: 2025-09-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: FEDERAL OFFICE FOR THE ENVIRONMENT BAFU, AIR POLLUTION CONTROL DEPARTMENT AND CHEMICALS
output.Summary: Documentation Site Air Pollution and Health (Ludok 2026+)

The law contains a binding catalog of criteria on how to set IGW. Based At the status of science or experience, IGW, among other things, must be determined in such a way that immissions below these values do not endanger people, animals and plants and do not significantly disturb the population in their well -being (Art. 13 and 14 USG). If there is no IGW for a pollutant, The immissions are considered excessive if they endanger people, animals and plants and significantly disrupt the population in their well -being (Art. 2 Para. 5 LRV). The authority must assess whether the determined immissions are excessive (Art. 30 LRV).<br> The BAFU - as the environmental authority of the federal government - has the task of pursuing the progressive state of scientific knowledge of the health effects of air pollutants, evaluating immissions, informing the population and, if necessary, an application for an adaptation of the immission limit values of the To provide air pollution regulation (LRV). input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE FOR THE ENVIRONMENT BAFU, DIRECTORATE AREA CLIMATE. Summary: Climate Test for Financial Institutions 2026-2027 with a Focus of Real Estate and Mortgages. Description: The KLV Climate Protection Ordinance stipulates that the Federal Office for the Environment BAFU is carrying out a voluntary climate test for the Swiss financial market at least every two years. With the regular climate test, the federal government is intended to state the climate -compatible orientation of the financial means flows, the progress and remaining challenges can determine. A review should also be possible where and how the Swiss financial market makes an effective climate contribution. The KLV came into force on 01.01.2025. The BAFU has already gained experience with such climate test. There are different ones for that Test modules developed and continuously developed. The climate test currently consists of three modules:<br> - Real estate/mortgage module (quantitative)<br> - stocks/corporate bond module (quantitative)<br> - Questionnaire on climate -relevant strategies and measures (qualitative)<br> A next test round is for 2026 planned. Above all, the tender includes the preparation and application of the Immobilien/Hypothek module. The further development and application of the module stock and corporate bonds is not the subject of the present order. The qualitative questionnaire is in terms of content by the BAFU further developed and adapted to the current federal needs. However, close coordination during the project with all modules will be important. On behalf of the BAFU, an additional module for benefits in biodiversity in global investments is currently ent.... Published Date: 2025-08-07. Closing Date: 2025-09-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: GENEVA AIRPORT. Summary: Insonorisation Program - Pollutant Design / Diagnostic Offices / Acoustic Diagnostic. Description: The market concerns the service of design offices (assistance), polluting diagnostics as well as acoustic diagnostics to be issued within the framework of the soundproofing program set up by Geneva Airport for the benefit of residents of the airport platform.<br> The market is divided into 3 Distinct lots, which can be awarded to several contractors.<br> Design offices<br> As part of the soundproofing program, the agents of lot 1 support GA in the implementation of the soundproofing program by applying established processes, coordinating the steps with Owners, by piloting diagnostics in collaboration with the agents of lots 2 and 3, etc.<br> Polluting diagnostic<br> As part of the soundproofing program, Lot 2 representatives carry out at the request of GA and/or the agents of lot 1 the samples and analyzes required In terms of pollutants (asbestos, lead, PCB, etc.)<br> Acoustic diagnostic<br> As part of the soundproofing program, the agents of Lot 3 carry out at the request of GA and/or the agents of Lot 1 the necessary acoustic analyzes.<br> Doc Title: soundproofing program - design offices / Pollutant diagnosis / acoustic diagnostic<br> Type contract: Services. Published Date: 2025-07-24. Closing Date: 2025-09-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Insonorisation Program - Pollutant Design / Diagnostic Offices / Acoustic Diagnostic

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: ZEBA - ZUGER MOUNTAINS FOR THE MANAGEMENT OF WASTE (SWISS RECYCLE). Summary: Cleaning of Sub- and Surface Containers. Description: Machine water cleaning and maintenance check from upper and underfloor containers in the area of ​​Zeba, Dileca, the city of Adliswil and the municipality of Horgen. Around 670 containers per year are totally to be cleaned (as of June 2025). The cleaning must be carried out with cleaning vehicles, which have a permissible total weight of at least 26 t. The vehicles must also be equipped with an assembly with a cleaning chamber and a crane.<br> Pressure and temperature must be adapted to the degree of contamination of the containers. However, the cleaning can be found with at least 50 C Warm water and a pressure of at least 100 bar. These companies receive an assurance if the assessment is positive. The guarantee becomes banks or othersgranted suitable loans. Since the start of the technology fund in 2015, a total of 212 guarantees have been issued by the end of 2024. <br> The operational continuation of the technology fund should be outsourced as before to an external office. This checks the applications both in terms ofits technological suitability as well as the financial structure and load -bearing capacity of the company. It ensures equal treatment and traceability of the decisions to the approval of the different applicants. Then she manages the guaranteesAnd accompanies the loan persons on behalf of the federal government. To do this, you have a comprehensive information system and ensures meaningful reporting and risk management. It also markets the range of technology funds for stimulating practical requests. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: PINI GROUP AG. Summary: Reservoir Headwood - Fittings and Pipes. Description: The municipalities of Rueschlikon and Kilchberg operate several reservoir systems in the headwood area for the supply of their upper pressure zones. Both communities are members of the simple company HTRK, which processed spring water from the Rothenturm area and to the partner communities of Horgen, Thalwil(Distributed in the Horgen) and Rueschlikon, Kilchberg (headwood in the sublop). These systems, including supply and derivations, come from 1907 and 1927 and have long since exceeded the expected useful life. At the same point, the Zweckverband Seewasserwerk Trkl has oneOwn reservoir system, which provides the participating communities of Thalwil, Rueschlikon, Kilchberg, Langnau and the municipality of Adliswil. The parties involved would like to extensively renew the existing systems and use each other as many synergies as possible. As part of theConcept phase were coordinated with the concerns and needs of all four clients (municipalities of Rueschlikon and Kilchberg, water supply HTRK, sea water plant Trkl) and presented in a joint system concept. The replacement new buildings should be placed in place of the existing systemsand as a common building complex with separate areas of responsibility are realized in stages. <br> Main CPV: 41000000 raw water and preparedWater. Published Date: 2025-04-29. Closing Date: 2025-05-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: STATE SECRETARIAT OF ECONOMIC AFFAIRS (SECO). Summary: Vietnam Swiss Urban Development Programme. Description: The Vietnam Swiss Urban Development Programme - developed carefully and in close collaboration with UDA - will be the SECO-s infrastructure financing divisions bilateral flagship project in Vietnam to strengthen urban development planning and urban climate resilience and support necessary reforms to a more integrated urban development approach in Vietnam. It will assist the Ministry of Construction (MoC) in facilitating the implementation of urban planning policies and programs, support innovative solutions to strengthen urban climate resilience and sustainable urban planning and management, and provide strategic advice on critical priorities on urban development. Support also aims at assisting cities in integrating and anticipating climate change risks in their urban development plans and strengthening disaster risk prevention by testing innovative solutions for urban flood risk reduction. <br> Doc Title: Vietnam Swiss Urban Development Programme <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-02-18. Closing Date: 2025-03-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Vietnam Swiss Urban Development Programme
output.Description: The Vietnam Swiss Urban Development Programme - developed carefully and in close collaboration with UDA - will be the SECO-s infrastructure financing divisions bilateral flagship project in Vietnam to strengthen urban development planning and urban climate resilience and support necessary reforms to a more integrated urban development approach in Vietnam. It will assist the Ministry of Construction (MoC) in facilitating the implementation of urban planning policies and programs, support innovative solutions to strengthen urban climate resilience and sustainable urban planning and management, and provide strategic advice on critical priorities on urban development. Support also aims at assisting cities in integrating and anticipating climate change risks in their urban development plans and strengthening disaster risk prevention by testing innovative solutions for urban flood risk reduction. <br> Doc Title: Vietnam Swiss Urban Development Programme <br> Contract Type: services
